title: Ohtani pitches into 5th but Dodgers fall out of 1st
content: Shohei Ohtani pitched for the first time as an opponent at Angel Stadium but saw the Dodgers lose their fourth straight -- and their grip on the top of the NL West.

title: NBA signs off on record-setting sale of Celtics
content: The NBA board of governors unanimously approved the sale of the Celtics to a group led by private equity mogul Bill Chisholm, a deal that values the franchise at more than $6.1 billion.

title: Ex-Broncos receiving great Taylor dies at age 89
content: Lionel Taylor, an original Denver Bronco and a member of the team's Ring of Fame, has died at the age of 89.

title: Rooney: Brady work ethic criticism was 'unfair'
content: Former Birmingham City manager Wayne Rooney has said Tom Brady's criticism about his work ethic was "unfair."

title: Cowboys' Jones: Experimental drug saved my life
content: Cowboys owner Jerry Jones said in an interview that he dealt with Stage 4 melanoma and that an experimental trial drug saved his life.

title: Brewers come through, win free burgers for city
content: Brandon Woodruff admitted there was "a little bit more at stake" when he pitched the Brewers to their 12th straight win, which meant free burgers for the city of Milwaukee.

title: L.A. to sell venue naming rights in Olympic first
content: Organizers of the Los Angeles Olympics will sell naming rights for a handful of its venues in deals expected to bring multiple millions of dollars to the 2028 Games.

title: First-half fracas results in 3 ejections in Sky-Sun
content: Three players were ejected from the Sun's win over the Sky following an altercation involving Connecticut's Bria Hartley and Chicago's Rebecca Allen and Ariel Atkins.

content: The son of Brad Johnson is entering his sixth year of college after rehabbing a broken leg, still hoping that he can play his way into the NFL draft.

content: LeBron will be a free agent next summer. Giannis and Jokic are eligible for massive extensions. But those aren't the only topics we're watching.

content: Atlanta will be the 2-seed in the playoffs, Seattle will reach the postseason and not one head coach will get fired.

content: Internet personality Davis Dodds is hosting a 24-hour Twitch livestream ahead of the NBA schedule release on Thursday.

content: Despite backlash, MSG Entertainment's "attorney exclusion list" is still in effect, reportedly banning over a thousand lawyers since 2022.

content: Not long ago, both N.Y. teams seemed to be cruising toward October -- then things took a turn for the worse.

content: What is going on in Dallas? The Micah Parsons situation is just the latest in a line of costly mistakes.

title: Manchester City's new 'rain-soaked' third kit is a total washout
content: Manchester City have gone all out to make a big splash with the source of creative inspiration for their new third kit -- the dreary Mancunian drizzle.

title: Michael Phelps offers swim lessons at Ravens training camp
content: The 23-time Olympic gold medalist gave some words of wisdom to the Baltimore Ravens before offering up swim lessons.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United push for Baleba, look at Wharton
content: Manchester United will make a concerted effort to sign Brighton midfielder Carlos Baleba or Crystal Palace's Adam Wharton. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: J&K cloudbursts: At least 38 dead in Kishtwar, floods hit Pahalgam; PM Modi takes stock
content: A devastating cloudburst in Jammu and Kashmir's Kishtwar district has claimed at least 12 lives near the Machail Mata temple, prompting a swift response from rescue teams. Simultaneously, heavy rain and flash floods have wreaked havoc in Himachal Pradesh, disrupting infrastructure and isolating villages.

title: 'Resolve to buy Indian products': Prez Murmu's message to nation amid Trump's tariffs
content: President Droupadi Murmu addressed the nation on the eve of the 79th Independence Day, highlighting India's journey towards self-reliance and confident progress. She emphasized the importance of democracy, the Constitution, and remembering the pain of partition. Murmu also underscored the core values of justice, liberty, equality, and fraternity, while noting the government's efforts to improve urban infrastructure.

title: 'Things are different now': India pacer on how Virat Kohli has changed over the years
content: Bhuvneshwar Kumar reflects on his evolving relationship with Virat Kohli, noting a shift from playful banter to discussions about family and life beyond cricket. Despite their off-field camaraderie, professionalism drives their performance on the field. Bhuvneshwar also praised Rajat Patidar's leadership and RCB's balanced team effort in securing their historic IPL 2025 victory.

title: GitHub CEO Thomas Dohmke: Wonâ€™t allow employees to refuse using GitHub
content: GitHub CEO Thomas Dohmke mandated the use of the platform for all employees, emphasizing its integral role in the company culture. Under his leadership, GitHub experienced significant growth, particularly with AI-powered development tools like GitHub Copilot. However, Dohmke has recently resigned to pursue entrepreneurial ventures, leading to GitHub's integration into Microsoft's CoreAI team by the end of 2025.

title: Op Sindoor: Experts back IAF claim of 5 Pak jets downed; hail 300km S-400 hit
content: International analysts corroborate Air Chief Marshal Amar Preet Singh's claims regarding Operation Sindoor, confirming the IAF's downing of multiple Pakistani jets, including a Saab 2000 early warning aircraft. Expert Tom Cooper highlights the S-400 missile system's successful strike at 300 km, a potential world record.

title: 92 all out! Ex-Pak cricketer slams Mike Hesson â€” 'I donâ€™t know what qualitiesâ€¦'
content: Shoaib Akhtar has criticized Mike Hesson's appointment as Pakistan's head coach after their dismal batting performance against West Indies. Akhtar questioned Hesson's ODI credentials and blamed poor policies for exposing players on seaming tracks. He also urged Babar Azam and Mohammad Rizwan to take more responsibility in finishing games, emphasizing the need for acceleration after reaching a half-century.

title: 8-0 in ODI WC, 7-1 in T20 WC â€” But what's India's record vs Pakistan in Asia Cup?
content: India dominated Pakistan in both ICC World Cups and Asia Cups, holding a significant lead in head-to-head records. Out of 18 Asia Cup clashes, India has won 10 compared to Pakistan's 6, securing eight titles against Pakistan's two. This year's Asia Cup, hosted in the UAE, will feature another high-stakes encounter between the two rivals.

title: Yes, the USA needs intel, as Intel is the only American company...: Former Intel CEO
content: Craig Barrett, ex-Intel CEO, suggests a $40 billion rescue plan. He urges major customers like Nvidia and Apple to invest. This aims to secure America's chip manufacturing future. Barrett criticizes current leadership's investment approach. He proposes tariffs on chip imports. President Trump seems to soften his stance on Intel's CEO after a meeting.

title: 'Painful consequences': India warns Pak to 'temper rhetoric'; 'hiding own failures'
content: India's Ministry of External Affairs has strongly condemned Pakistan's escalating anti-India rhetoric, warning of severe repercussions for any miscalculated actions. This response follows inflammatory statements by Pakistan's army chief, Asim Munir, including threats against India's Jamnagar refinery. India has voiced concerns regarding the absence of civilian control over Pakistan's nuclear decisions, highlighting the military's collaboration with terrorist groups.

title: Happy Independence Day 2025: Best messages, quotes, wishes and images to share
content: India commemorates its Independence Day on August 15th, marking the end of British rule and the nation's birth in 1947. The day honors freedom fighters like Mahatma Gandhi and Jawaharlal Nehru, who led the struggle for independence. The Prime Minister hoists the national flag at the Red Fort, echoing Nehru's historic act and speech.

title: Audi employees in Germany to the company: Cannot build a factory in America without ...
content: Audi's plan to establish a U.S. plant faces hurdles as labor leaders prioritize securing German jobs amidst President Trump's tariffs. The labor official, JÃ¶rg Schlagbauer, insists on long-term guarantees for German production before supporting U.S. expansion. Trump's tariffs, impacting European carmakers, prompt Audi to consider U.S.

title: UPSC CSE main 2025 admit card out; download here for Aug 22 exam
content: The UPSC has released the admit card for the CSE Main 2025 exam scheduled for August 22. Candidates can download their hall tickets from upsc.gov.in using their registration ID and date of birth. It is mandatory to carry the printed admit card and a valid photo ID on exam day. Candidates should verify details carefully and report discrepancies promptly. Multiple copies are advised, and Covid-19 protocols may apply at the exam centres.

title: Vece Paes borrowed Olympic medal from Dhyan Chandâ€™s son after losing his; but final wish went unmet
content: Dr. Vece Paes, the Olympic bronze medalist in hockey, passed away, leaving behind a legacy of sportsmanship and dedication. Despite battling Parkinson's in his later years, he sought to recreate his lost Olympic medal, even borrowing one from a former teammate.

title: LeBron James & Savannah: Untold love story revealed
content: Savannah James, wife of NBA star LeBron James, revealed in a podcast episode that their relationship might not have survived if LeBron hadn't been drafted by the Cleveland Cavaliers. She expressed uncertainty about their future had he not stayed close to home. Despite early challenges, including a teenage pregnancy, the couple persevered and married in 2013.

title: 'Weathered many challenges': India on ties with US ahead of Trump-Putin talks
content: Amidst tariff concerns, the Ministry of External Affairs has expressed confidence in the enduring strength of India-US relations, highlighting their ability to overcome challenges. The 21st edition of the joint military exercise 'Yudh Abhyas' is scheduled for later this month in Alaska, further solidifying defense cooperation.

title: Chaos! Pakistan A openers clashes mid-pitch vs Bangladesh A â€“ Watch
content: During a match between Pakistan A and Bangladesh A at the TIO Stadium in Darwin, openers Mohammad Nafay and Yasir Khan were involved in a heated on-field exchange. A mix-up led to Yasir's run-out, triggering a frustrated outburst where he threw his bat and hurled abuses.

title: 'Shami spends lakhs on mistress' kids': Hasin calls pacer 'womaniser'
content: Hasin Jahan, Mohammed Shami's estranged wife, has publicly accused the cricketer of neglecting their daughter Ayra's education while allegedly prioritizing the schooling of his girlfriend's children. Jahan claims Shami spends lavishly on his girlfriend and her children, including business class flights and elite school admissions, despite receiving Rs 4 lakh monthly alimony, with Rs 2.5 lakh specifically for Ayra's expenses.

title: Lake Nyos tragedy that killed 1,700 people overnight in Cameroon
content: In 1986, Lake Nyos in Cameroon experienced a devastating limnic eruption, releasing a massive carbon dioxide cloud that killed approximately 1,700 people and 3,500 animals. This rare phenomenon, caused by the sudden release of accumulated CO2, prompted scientific investigation and the implementation of degassing systems to prevent future disasters.

title: Renukaswamy murder case: Actor Darshan arrested after SC cancels bail
content: Kannada film star Darshan Thogudeepa was arrested after the Supreme Court overturned his bail in the Renukaswamy murder case. This followed the arrest of actress Pavithra Gowda, a co-accused. Darshan was apprehended at his wife's residence, reportedly planning to evade arrest. The Supreme Court cited witness intimidation allegations and irregularities in the High Court's bail order.

title: Prithvi Shaw takes first big step after Mumbai exit
content: Ruturaj Gaikwad and Prithvi Shaw have been included in Maharashtra's squad for the All India Buchi Babu Invitational Tournament, scheduled from August 18 to September 9 in Chennai. Ankit Bawane will captain the team.

title: Travis Kelce & Taylor Swift: Flirty â€˜New Heightsâ€™ moments; fans swoon
content: The New Heights podcast showcased the romance between Travis Kelce and Taylor Swift. Swift revealed 'Red' as her favorite album. Kelce admired her vocabulary. He described being captivated by Swift during her Eras Tour. Kelce expressed his desire to meet her after the show. He praised her stage presence and their easy connection.

title: Rattled by Op Sindoor, Pakistan hastily props up new missile force
content: Following Operation Sindoor, Pakistan is bolstering its military by establishing the Army Rocket Force Command to oversee its missile arsenal. Equipped with modern technology, this force aims to enhance conventional war capabilities. Amidst rising tensions and increased military spending, Pakistan also plans to acquire new fighter jets and air defense systems, while acknowledging support from friendly nations.

title: Rift in SP? MLA Pooja Pal expelled for praising CM Yogi Adityanath
content: The Samajwadi Party expelled MLA Pooja Pal for anti-party activities after she praised Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath. Pal thanked Adityanath for delivering justice in her husband's murder case by eliminating criminals like Atiq Ahmed through policies like zero tolerance.

title: Who is Ravi Ghai? Meet Arjun Tendulkar's future in-law
content: Arjun Tendulkar, son of Sachin Tendulkar, is reportedly engaged to Saaniya Chandok, granddaughter of Mumbai businessman Ravi Ghai. The families have yet to confirm the engagement, which reportedly took place on Wednesday. Saaniya's grandfather, Ravi Ghai, heads the Graviss Group, a prominent hospitality and food-and-beverage company with a 70-year legacy in the industry.

title: Deep ocean mission: Indian aquanauts make record 5,000-metre dive
content: India has achieved a significant milestone with its aquanauts successfully reaching depths exceeding 5,000 metres in the North Atlantic, marking progress in the Deep Ocean Mission. This follows closely after an Indian astronaut's visit to the International Space Station.

title: Electoral rolls show duplicate entries; EC probes LJP MP Veena Devi & husband
content: The Election Commission of India has issued notices to MP Veena Devi and her husband, MLC Dinesh Prasad Singh, following allegations of dual voter registration. Tejashwi Yadav publicly accused them of possessing multiple voter ID cards and being listed in different assembly constituencies. The ECI has initiated a formal inquiry, seeking responses from the couple by August 16, 2025.

title: AC duct treasure: 316 whisky bottles seized after passenger reported cooling issues
content: As Bihar gears up for elections, liquor smuggling intensifies. On the Lucknow-Barauni Express, authorities discovered 316 whisky bottles hidden in an AC duct after a passenger reported cooling issues. A coach attendant from Bihar, Ashish Kumar, was arrested; he confessed to smuggling liquor regularly from Uttar Pradesh to sell in Bihar's black market, exploiting prohibition laws.

title: 'Made huge contribution to cricket': Ratnakar recalls Vece Paesâ€™ role in BCCI
content: Dr. Vece Paes, Olympian and father of Leander Paes, passed away at 80, leaving behind a legacy of contributions to Indian sports. He significantly impacted the BCCI by heading age verification and anti-doping departments, introducing the TW3 method to combat age fraud and launching educational programs featuring cricket icons.

title: Delhi rain: Man dies, daughter injured as massive tree falls on vehicles in Kalkaji
content: In Kalkaji, South Delhi, a neem tree collapsed due to heavy rains on Thursday morning, critically injuring two individuals. Sudhir Kumar, 50, and his daughter Priya, 22, were riding a motorcycle when the tree fell on them. They were promptly rescued and taken to Safdarjung Trauma Centre.

title: 'Ask your paw paw ...': Cong mocks BJP's Sonia voter row; 'good photoshop'
content: Congress refuted BJP's claims regarding Sonia Gandhi's voter registration. They alleged BJP used manipulated documents. Trinamool Congress MP accused Amit Malviya of forgery. BJP had alleged Sonia Gandhi enrolled as a voter twice without proper citizenship. They questioned the timing of her Indian citizenship acquisition. The parties exchanged accusations on social media platform X.

title: Junagadh horror: Dalit man beaten, abused for â€˜sporting moustache & beardâ€™
content: In a Junagadh village, a Dalit man, Sagar Makwana, was allegedly assaulted and subjected to casteist slurs by upper-caste individuals for sporting a moustache and beard. The attack, which also severely injured Makwana's father-in-law, occurred after a confrontation escalated over Makwana's appearance. Police have registered a case and are actively pursuing the accused, who face charges under the Atrocities Act.

title: 75+ Happy Independence Day messages, greetings, wishes and quotes for 2025
content: India will celebrate Independence Day on August 15, 2025. The day honors freedom fighters' sacrifices. People share wishes with family and friends. Messages reflect freedom and national pride. Celebrations include patriotic songs and flag hoisting. Citizens pledge to protect unity. The day promotes love for the nation. It encourages remembering the past and dreaming of tomorrow. Jai Hind

title: Amidst Trump's tariff war, S&P upgrades India's credit rating to 'BBB' from 'BBB-'
content: S&P Global has upgraded India's credit rating to 'BBB' with a stable outlook, a significant boost despite potential US tariffs. S&P anticipates that the Trump administration's tariffs, including those on crude oil trade with Russia, will not significantly impact India's economic growth.

title: IKEA India opens store in Delhi: 15,000 sq ft outlet at Pacific Mall
content: IKEA India has inaugurated its first Delhi store in Pacific Mall, Tagore Garden, marking its fourth city presence after Hyderabad, Mumbai, and Bengaluru. The 15,000 sq ft outlet features over 2,000 home furnishing products, blending physical accessibility with online convenience. This launch is a significant milestone in IKEA's India expansion, aiming to bring affordable Scandinavian design closer to Delhi residents.

title: Watch: BMW sedan gets stranded on waterlogged Delhi road; traffic snarls
content: Heavy rain hit Delhi and surrounding areas. A BMW was stranded due to waterlogging in APS Colony. The downpour caused traffic disruptions across the city. The India Meteorological Department issued an orange alert. Several areas recorded significant rainfall. Ring Road and other key roads faced traffic jams. Commuters experienced inconvenience due to the weather. More rain is expected.

title: Stray dogs case: SC blames 'inaction' of authorities; 10 takeaways from hearing
content: The Supreme Court has reserved its order on a plea to stay its earlier directive regarding stray dogs in Delhi-NCR, expressing strong disapproval of local authorities' inaction. The court heard arguments highlighting the severity of dog bite incidents and the need for a resolution, while also considering concerns about the removal of stray dogs from the streets and the lack of adequate shelter facilities.

title: Palghar poll list glitch: Voterâ€™s name appears 6 times
content: The discovery of a Palghar woman's name appearing six times on electoral rolls has triggered an investigation ordered by collector Indu Jakhar to rectify the discrepancy. This duplication, highlighted on social media, prompted the Chief Electoral Officer to seek a detailed report and immediate resolution.

title: US wants deeper Pak ties: Trump admin eyes minerals, hydrocarbons
content: Amid stalled trade talks with India, the US government aims to strengthen economic ties with Pakistan, focusing on critical minerals and hydrocarbons. Secretary of State Rubio highlighted the ongoing partnership, while Trump has in the past spoken of potential collaboration on Pakistan's oil reserves.

title: Renukaswamy murder case: SC cancels actor Darshan's bail; orders his immediate arrest
content: The Supreme Court overturned the Karnataka High Court's decision, cancelling the bail of Kannada actor Darshan Thoogudeepa, his girlfriend Pavithra Gowda, and five others implicated in the Renukaswamy murder case. Darshan was arrested with 16 others for allegedly abducting, torturing, and murdering Renukaswamy, a 33-year-old fan.

title: Ahead Of Trump-Putin Talks, Key US Official's Big Warning On India Tariffs
content: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent has warned India of increasing secondary tariffs over the Russian oil trade. He said the raise in tariffs is dependent on the outcome of US President Trump's high-stakes meeting with Russian President Putin.

title: US Threatens India Of Additional Tariffs If Trump-Putin Peace Deal Fails
content: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent has warned that the secondary tariffs on India could go up if "things don't go well" during talks between President Donald Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin in Alaska on Friday.

title: 15 Million Primary-Age Girls Out Of School Wordwide, Says UN Report
content: 15 million primary-age girls around the world are currently out of school, as systemic gender discrimination continues to hinder equal access to education for girls and young women globally.

title: Spotlight On Op Sindoor, Air Force As Distinguished Service Awards Announced
content: The Sarvottam Yudh Seva Medal -- the country's highest wartime distinguished service decoration - will be awarded to seven officers of the armed forces, bringing the spotlight on Operation Sindoor and their contribution in it

title: 38 Dead, 100 Injured After Massive J&K Cloudburst, Army Joins Rescue Efforts
content: At least 32 people have been killed after a massive cloudburst caused a flash flood in the Chashoti village of Jammu and Kashmir's Kishtwar district this afternoon. Rescue teams have been rushed to the spot and visuals showed pilgrims being evacuated

title: How UK's Attempt For Indian Support In World War Became Quit India Catalyst
content: By early 1942, Britain was in trouble in Southeast Asia. Japan was advancing quickly toward India, and the Allies were losing.

title: All You Need To Know About Revolt Of 1857: How Indians Challenged The British
content: When the British East India Company refused to recognise Rani Lakshmi Bai's adopted son's claim to the throne, the queen of Jhansi took up arms.

title: Jammu And Kashmir Cloudburst Live Updates: "Will Provide All Possible Help," Says PM Modi, Rescue Ops On
content: At least 32 people died, including two Central Industrial Security Force (CISF) personnel,Â after a massive cloudburst struck Chashoti village in Jammu and Kashmir's Kishtwar district on Thursday.

title: "Better Recalcitrant Than...": Shashi Tharoor On US Official's India Remark
content: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor on Thursday hit back at US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent's, after he said that India has been a "bit recalcitrant" on trade negotiations with the US.

title: After S&P Rating Upgrade, BJP Attacks Rahul Gandhi Over "Dead Economy" Remark
content: The comment of Congress's Rahul Gandhi that India is a "dead economy" had backfired after S&P Global Ratings raised its long-term unsolicited sovereign credit ratings on India to 'BBB' from 'BBB-', and its short-term ratings to 'A-2' from 'A-3'.

title: Maoist-hit Bastar Villages to Hoist Tricolour First Time Since Independence
content: Fourteen remote villages in Chhattisgarh's Maoist-hit Bastar region will witness hoisting of the national flag for the first time since India gained freedom, with locals enthusiastically preparing for Friday's Independence Day celebrations.

title: As Top Court Reserves Decision On Delhi's Stray Dogs, Key Points From Earlier Order
content: The Supreme Court has reserved its order on petitions challenging its August 11 directive to remove all stray dogs from Delhi-NCR streets and confine them permanently in shelters.

title: 8-Year-Old Falls Into Open Drain In UP, Swept For 50 Metres, Dies
content: On her way home from school, an eight-year-old fell into a drain and was swept 50 metres away before her body was retrieved by locals in Uttar Pradesh's Gorakhpur.

title: In Attack On Samajwadi Party, Yogi Adityanath's Frog And Rooster Analogies
content: Taking a series of jabs at the Samajwadi Party during a 24-hour discussion on Vision 2047 for Uttar Pradesh, Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath on Thursday said the party's slogan of PDA stood for 'Parivar (Family) Development Authority'.

title: Actor Darshan Arrested Hours After Supreme Court Cancelled His Bail
content: Hours after his bail was cancelled by the Supreme Court in connection with the murder of his fan Renukaswamy, actor Darshan has been arrested by the Bengaluru Police.

title: The RG Kar Horror: When The "Safest City" Stood In Silence
content: A year ago, on this day, the rape and murder of a young doctor at a state-run hospital in Kolkata had exposed the worst fears of the women working night shifts in the city known to be the safest among metros.

title: "Painful Consequences": India's "Temper Your Rhetoric" Advice To Pakistan
content: In India warned the Pakistani leadership that any "misadventure" will have "painful consequences". Speaking at the weekly media briefing, MEA spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal referenced reports regarding "war-mongering" by Pakistan against India.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Top Court's Stray Dogs Order Can Cost A Fortune. But That's Not The Point
content: Housing Delhi's 10 lakh dogs would require at least Rs 10,000 crore in construction alone, more than half of Delhi's entire Rs 17,224 crore capital outlay for all development in 2025-26.

title: "Weathered Many Challenges": India Hopes Ties With US Will Move Forward
content: India, days after the massive tariff imposed by US President Donald Trump, declared that the relations between the world largest and the oldest democracy were based on "substantive agenda" on which it would remain focussed.

title: "Are They Maoists?" EPS Slams MK Stalin Over Action Against Sanitation Workers
content: AIADMK leader Edappadi K Palaniswami (EPS) has launched a huge attack on the DMK government in Tamil Nadu led by MK Stalin over the state government's alleged ill-treatment of sanitation workers.

title: Lurking concerns for top 10 NBA contenders for the 2025-26 season
content: NBA insiders break down the biggest under-the-radar concerns for 10 teams with the best odds to win the title . the playoffs are 10 months away, but it's never too early to recognize potential roster holes or franchise concerns .

title: Pacquiao title shot -- again? Joshua vs. Jake Paul? Canelo on canvas? Don't be surprised
content: the first eight months of 2025 have been interesting, to say the least . the last four months of the year will be dominated by Terence Crawford's bid to become a three-division undisputed champion when he makes the incomprehensible climb of two weight classes to 168 pounds to challenge Canelo Alvarez on sept. 13 .

title: MLB Awards Watch: August update on MVP, CY Young and more
content: this month's awards watch reflects changes atop some races and separation in others . the two methods of tracking these things are in complete accord when it comes to anointing the current favorites . a lot can and will change in short period of time in a big league baseball season .

title: LaLiga questions: Barcelona-Madrid title race; MbappÃ© vs. Yamal
content: real madrid are favourites to win laLiga this coming season . the 2025-26 season kicks off with two matches on friday . it's just over a month since the club world cup ended . atlÃ©tico Madrid have signed seven new players in this transfer .

title: How do teams approach training camp with a rookie quarterback?
content: new coach Dan Quinn wanted to make sure the situation was right . Quinn spent time analyzing what he'd do differently the next time . he hadn't built his coaching staff to withstand success . the team went to the super bowl in the 2016 season .

title: Predicting 2025-26, from Premier League title race to most entertaining teams
content: the 2025-26 european soccer season kicks off in the premier league on friday . laLiga and Ligue 1 also begin play this weekend, with the Bundesliga and Serie A beginning the following week . we asked each of them to provide one big, bold prediction that we'll be sure to revisit at the end of the season .

title: Expert picks, best bets for UFC 319 and PFL championships
content: the UFC is in Chicago on Saturday for its last pay-per-view of the summer . the PFL world championships continue from Charlotte, North Carolina, on Friday (9 p.m. ET on ESPN+ PPV . neither fighter has lost inside the Octagon, with du Plessis a perfect 9-0 with six early stoppages .

title: Draft Guide: Rankings, mock drafts and analysis
content: this draft guide will serve as one-stop shop for all of our best fantasy football picks possible in every draft you're in . we have everything needed to help you draft a great team and start the season with a shot . it doesn't matter whether you have been doing this for years or are a first-timer .

title: I donâ€™t see any reason for me to contest outside of NDA: Chirag Paswan
content: While defending his recent critical remarks against the Bihar government, Mr. Paswan said he wonâ€™t contest the Assembly polls outside of the NDA, unless he is pushed to a corner, which for now is not happening

title: Got caught up in sharp contests among political parties: ECI to Supreme Court
content: ECâ€™s counsel points to allegations raised against it about EVMs, and now the portrayal of special intensive revision  exercise in Bihar as â€œcitizenship screeningâ€

title: Child-secure Kerala action plan unveiled
content: Workshop held by WCD department to fix responsibility matrix for stakeholder departments to achieve targets outlined in action plan

title: Pinarayi to inaugurate second edition of International Literature Festival on August 17
content: The five-day literary fiesta will feature discussions, lectures, author interactions, childrenâ€™s literary sessions, cultural performances, and plays across three venues, with over 70 sessions planned

title: Free bus ride for women from today poses multiple challenges to APSRTC
content: The expected surge in passengers is likely to put a strain on the existing fleet, especially during peak hours, making crowd control a daunting task, while impacting the revenues and profitability of the cash-strapped corporation

title: ASHAs form human chain, stage demonstration as part of protest in several districts
content: Accredited Social Health Activists stage demonstrations in the districts of Dharwad, Haveri, Gadag, Uttara Kannada and Davangere

title: Kannur gears up to prepare Stateâ€™s first district water budget
content: â€˜The budget aims to make citizens water literate by publicly presenting data on water availability and usage at a time when freshwater sources are dwindling amid rising consumptionâ€™

title: Truth of triumph, says Bihar Congress on Supreme Courtâ€™s SIR order
content: Party terms interim order as â€œfirst victoryâ€, says order a â€œbig step to protect democratic valuesâ€ and prevent a â€œploy to steal votesâ€ in Bihar

title: Supreme Court order on SIR is a massive victory for democracy: Congress
content: The top courtâ€™s order to make machine-readable rolls available, and to allow Aadhaar as proof of identity and residence is in line with Rahul Gandhiâ€™s demands; he will lead Vote Adhikar Yatra in Bihar from August 17

title: Dhanlaxmi Bank, NSIC ink pact to enhance credit facilitation for MSMEs
content: MSMEs can now approach any NSIC branch to receive assistance in preparing and submitting credit proposals to all branches of Dhanlaxmi Bank

title: Thrissurâ€™s votersâ€™ list row boils over as parties arm themselves for legal battle
content: Fresh allegations link BJP central leadership to software manipulation. CPI demands Supreme Court-monitored probe

title: Instead of appealing against toll suspension, do something, Supreme Court tells NHAI
content: Kerala High Court ordered suspension of toll collection at Paliyekkara toll plaza in Thrissur district in  view of the poor condition of the Edapallyâ€“Mannuthy stretch of National Highway 544

title: Revision of report on internal reservation for Scheduled Castes sought; protest staged
content: Members of the Dalit Right community take out a procession and stage a demonstration outside the Deputy Commissionerâ€™s office in Kalaburagi

title: Bridge under construction collapses in Koyilandy
content: Residents allege laxity on the part of Public Works department officials in checking the quality and quantity of materials used in construction

title: Master plan unveiled for expansion of Technopark Phase IV in Thiruvananthapuram
content: The master plan integrates IT infrastructure, research centers, academic institutions, and sustainable living spaces. Plan includes dedicated zones for IT, ITeS, electronics, and emerging technology sectors.

title: Whistle-blower doctor Haris Chirackal replies to show-cause notice
content: The doctor pointed out that he complained about the unavailability of surgical equipment several times. He said he spoke out because of his distress and frustration over surgeries getting postponed in the department and that it was not meant to bring disgrace to the government.

title: Special Economic Zone for electronics sanctioned in Dharwad, says Joshi
content: A Central gazette notification says that 28 acres have been earmarked at the Hubballi Durable Goods Cluster for the proposed electronics units

title: Wild elephants killed 97 people in three years in Karnataka, says Khandre
content: Environment and Forest Minister Eshwar Khandre informed the Legislative Assembly that wild elephants have trampled to death 97 people in the State during the last three years. The government has paid â‚¹13.65 crore as compensation

title: Secure Central funds, boost A.P.â€™s revenue sources, Naidu tells officials
content: Chief Minister says services sector offers significant untapped potential for generating additional tax income; projects 8% increase in Stateâ€™s revenue this fiscal

title: BJP accuses Congress govt. of â€˜smear campaignâ€™ against Dharmasthala, Heggade
content: The Opposition demands tabling of interim report on SIT probe and claimed a â€˜conspiracyâ€™ to malign the temple town

title: UDF suffers a blow in Vaikom as Kerala Congress councillor joins CPI(M)
content: Sindhu Sajeevan, who represents Ward 13 and serves as chairperson of the municipalityâ€™s development standing committee, joins CPI(M)

title: Green gram, cotton likely to be hit by copious rainfall in Yadgir district
content: The district receives 23 mm rainfall in 24 hours ended at 8.30 a.m. on Thursday against an average of 7 mm

title: Andhra Pradesh Secretariat launches jute bag stalls as part of drive against single-use plastics
content: Organised under the aegis of Mission for Elimination of Poverty in Municipal Areas, the initiative aims at making Andhra Pradesh a plastic-free State by World Environment Day-2026

title: Scheme launched to provide entrepreneurial opportunities to Haritha Karma Sena workers
content: The initiative is will focus on establishing value-added enterprises under each local bodyâ€™s HKS consortium, with activities including cloth bag production, organic fertilizer manufacturing, scrap trading and a host of other options.

title: PM Modi marks â€˜Partition Horrors Remembrance Dayâ€™
content: Mr. Modi says, â€œIt was a day to honour the grit and ability to face unimaginable loss of the victims and survivors of the violence that followed the partition of Indiaâ€

title: Three-year-old girl injured in leopard attack in Prakasam district of A.P.
content: The animal grabbed the girl in its mouth when she was sleeping outside her house at the tribal hamlet of Chinnarutla in Dornala mandal

title: Over 56,000 women to benefit from Stree Shakti initiative in Annamayya district, say RTC officials
content: Expecting a huge surge in the women commuters, the officials have earmarked 480 buses out of the districtâ€™s total fleet of 545, operating from Rayachoti, Rajampet, Pileru, Madanapalle-1, and Madanapalle-2 depots

title: Students urged to develop the habit of reading
content: National Librarians Day jointly hosted by the IQAC departments of Library and Languages of S.J.M.V.S. Arts and Commerce for Women College

title: Adichilthotti tribal hamletâ€™s organic triumph
content: The tribal settlement in Chalakudy wins second place in the Kerala State Farm Awards for excellence in organic farming

title: Watch: Meet the Pakistani nationals granted Indian citizenship
content: That wait for Indian citizenship ended for 181 Pakistani nationals in Gujarat this July when they received it under the Citizenship Amendment Act, or CAA. Four others were granted it through the discretionary powers of local authorities. What was the experience like?

title: CPI(M) cracks down on members who publicly criticised Health Minister
content: Eraviperoor area committee recommends demotion of former Child Welfare Committee chairman N. Rajeev to Vallamkulam local committee. P.J. Johnson, member of Elanthoor local committee, suspended for three months

title: CM Stalin will not take part in Independence Day tea party to be hosted by Governor Ravi: TN govt
content: The Chief Minister's boycott is to show opposition to Governor Ravi, who "acts against the interests of Tamil Nadu people, the State government said

title: Dilapidated school building in Tiruverumbur poses danger to students
content: Built in 1962, the school has just two classrooms, lacks a compound wall, and has no functional toilet for either students or teachers and its roof is prone to damage during rain

title: Arun Nehru demands cold storage at Musiri to help banana farmers
content: The Perambalur MP says farmers were often forced to sell the produce at a throwaway price in the absence of a modern cold storage facility in the region

title: In customary Independence Day eve speech, Governor Ravi flags four â€˜very serious challengesâ€™ facingÂ Tamil Nadu
content: Educational and social discrimination of the poor and marginalised, alarming rise in suicides, drug abuse among youth, and a steep rise in rape and other sexual offences against women and girls were some of the issues flagged by the Governor

title: Local bodies in Kozhikode to initiate stringent measures against people who abandon pets
content: List of dog owners who are yet to comply with the registration formalities to be prepared in the limits of various local bodies in the district as part of the action plan

title: Forensic tests confirm bloodstains at accusedâ€™s house belong to missing woman Jainamma
content: Besides Jainamma, the accused is also under investigation in connection with the disappearances of two other women.
